query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 «Ecco la fiera con la coda aguzza, 2 che passa i monti e rompe i muri e l’armi! 3 Ecco colei che tutto ’l mondo appuzza!».
query.result:
**English:**
1 "Behold the beast with the sharp tail, 2 that crosses mountains and breaks through walls and weapons! 3 Behold her who stinks up the whole world!"
**Malay:**
1 "Lihatlah binatang buas dengan ekor yang tajam, 2 yang melintasi gunung dan merobohkan tembok dan senjata! 3 Lihatlah dia yang membuat seluruh dunia bau busuk!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
4 Sì cominciò lo mio duca a parlarmi; 5 e accennolle che venisse a proda, 6 vicino al fin d’i passeggiati marmi.
query.result:
**English:**
4 My guide began to speak to me; 5 and he beckoned me to come to the shore, 6 near the end of the marble pavement.
**Malay:**
4 Mulailah pemanduku berbicara kepadaku; 5 dan dia memberi isyarat agar aku datang ke pantai, 6 dekat dengan ujung jalan setapak marmer.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
7 E quella sozza imagine di froda 8 sen venne, e arrivò la testa e ’l busto, 9 ma ’n su la riva non trasse la coda.
query.result:
**English:**
7 And that foul image of fraud 8 came forward, and its head and chest appeared, 9 but it did not drag its tail up onto the bank.
**Malay:**
7 Dan gambaran penipuan yang menjijikkan itu 8 datang, dan kepala serta dadanya muncul, 9 tetapi ekornya tidak diseretnya ke atas tebing.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 Con più color, sommesse e sovraposte 17 non fer mai drappi Tartari né Turchi, 18 né fuor tai tele per Aragne imposte.
query.result:
**English:**
16 With more colors, subdued and superimposed, 17 never did Tartar or Turkish cloths make, 18 nor outside there cloths imposed for Arachne.
**Malay:**
16 Dengan lebih banyak warna, lembut dan bertindih, 17 tidak pernah kain Tartar atau Turki dibuat, 18 atau di luar sana kain yang dikenakan untuk Arachne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
19 Come talvolta stanno a riva i burchi, 20 che parte sono in acqua e parte in terra, 21 e come là tra li Tedeschi lurchi
22 lo bivero s’assetta a far sua guerra, 23 così la fiera pessima si stava 24 su l’orlo ch’è di pietra e ’l sabbion serra.
query.result:
**English:**
19 As boats sometimes stand by the shore, 20 partly in the water and partly on land, 21 and as there among the sluggish Germans
22 the beaver settles down to wage its war, 23 so the evil beast stood 24 on the edge where the rock and sand meet.
**Malay:**
19 Seperti perahu yang kadang-kadang berdiri di tepi pantai, 20 sebagian di dalam air dan sebagian di darat, 21 dan seperti di sana di antara orang-orang Jerman yang lamban
22 berang-berang duduk untuk berperang, 23 demikianlah binatang buas yang jahat itu berdiri 24 di tepi batu dan pasir bertemu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Nel vano tutta sua coda guizzava, 26 torcendo in sù la venenosa forca 27 ch’a guisa di scorpion la punta armava.
query.result:
**English:**
25 In the void, his entire tail thrashed, 26 twisting upward the venomous barb 27 that, scorpion-like, armed its tip.
**Malay:**
25 Di ruang hampa, seluruh ekornya bergoyang, 26 memutar ke atas sengatan berbisa 27 yang, seperti kalajengking, mempersenjatai ujungnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Lo duca disse: «Or convien che si torca 29 la nostra via un poco insino a quella 30 bestia malvagia che colà si corca».
query.result:
**English:**
28 The leader said: "Now it is necessary that 29 our path turn a little towards that 30 evil beast that lies down over there".
**Malay:**
28 Pemimpin itu berkata: "Sekarang sudah saatnya 29 jalan kita berbelok sedikit ke arah 30 binatang buas yang berbaring di sana".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
31 Però scendemmo a la destra mammella, 32 e diece passi femmo in su lo stremo, 33 per ben cessar la rena e la fiammella.
query.result:
**English:**
31 But we descended to the right breast, 32 and we took ten steps along the edge, 33 to avoid both the sand and the flame.
**Malay:**
31 Tetapi kami turun ke payudara kanan, 32 dan kami mengambil sepuluh langkah di sepanjang tepi, 33 untuk menghindari pasir dan api.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 E quando noi a lei venuti semo, 35 poco più oltre veggio in su la rena 36 gente seder propinqua al loco scemo.
query.result:
**English:**
34 And when we came to her, 35 a little farther on I see upon the sand 36 people sitting near the empty place.
**Malay:**
34 Dan ketika kami datang kepadanya, 35 sedikit lebih jauh lagi kulihat di atas pasir 36 orang-orang duduk dekat tempat yang kosong.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Quivi ’l maestro «Acciò che tutta piena 38 esperïenza d’esto giron porti», 39 mi disse, «va, e vedi la lor mena.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Here the master said to me, "So that you may carry away a full 38 experience of this circle," 39 "go and see their punishment."
**Malay:**
37 Di sini sang guru berkata kepadaku, "Agar engkau dapat membawa pergi pengalaman penuh dari lingkaran ini," 38 "pergilah dan lihatlah hukuman mereka." 39

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
40 Li tuoi ragionamenti sian là corti; 41 mentre che torni, parlerò con questa, 42 che ne conceda i suoi omeri forti».
query.result:
**English:**
40 Let your arguments be brief here; 41 while you return, I will speak with this one, 42 that she may grant us her strong shoulders.
**Malay:**
40 Biarlah alasan-alasanmu singkat di sini; 41 sementara kamu kembali, aku akan berbicara dengan yang ini, 42 agar dia memberikan kita bahunya yang kuat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 Così ancor su per la strema testa 44 di quel settimo cerchio tutto solo 45 andai, dove sedea la gente mesta.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Thus still upward over the outermost head 44 of that seventh circle all alone 45 I went, where the sorrowful people were seated.
**Malay:**
43 Begitu juga masih ke atas di atas kepala terluar 44 dari lingkaran ketujuh itu sendirian 45 aku pergi, di mana orang-orang yang bersedih duduk.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 Per li occhi fora scoppiava lor duolo; 47 di qua, di là soccorrien con le mani 48 quando a’ vapori, e quando al caldo suolo:
49 non altrimenti fan di state i cani 50 or col ceffo or col piè, quando son morsi 51 o da pulci o da mosche o da tafani.
query.result:
**English:**
46 Through their eyes their sorrow burst forth; 47 here and there they helped themselves with their hands, 48 now to the vapors, and now to the hot soil:
49 not otherwise do dogs in summer 50 now with their snout, now with their paw, when they are bitten 51 either by fleas or by flies or by gadflies.
**Malay:**
46 Melalui mata mereka kesedihan mereka meledak; 47 di sini, di sana mereka membantu diri mereka sendiri dengan tangan mereka, 48 sekarang ke uap, dan sekarang ke tanah yang panas:
49 tidak lain yang dilakukan anjing di musim panas 50 sekarang dengan moncongnya, sekarang dengan kakinya, ketika mereka digigit 51 baik oleh kutu atau lalat atau pengganggu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 Poi che nel viso a certi li occhi porsi, 53 ne’ quali ’l doloroso foco casca, 54 non ne conobbi alcun; ma io m’accorsi
55 che dal collo a ciascun pendea una tasca 56 ch’avea certo colore e certo segno, 57 e quindi par che ’l loro occhio si pasca.
query.result:
**English:**
52 Then when I turned my eyes to their faces, 53 into which the sorrowful fire fell, 54 I recognized none of them; but I noticed
55 that from the neck of each one hung a pouch 56 that had a certain color and a certain sign, 57 and from this it seemed that their eyes found nourishment.
**Malay:**
52 Kemudian ketika aku mengalihkan pandanganku ke wajah mereka, 53 ke mana api kesedihan jatuh, 54 aku tidak mengenali seorang pun; tetapi aku menyadari
55 bahwa dari leher masing-masing tergantung sebuah kantong 56 yang memiliki warna dan tanda tertentu, 57 dan dari situ tampaknya mata mereka menemukan makanan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 E com’ io riguardando tra lor vegno, 59 in una borsa gialla vidi azzurro 60 che d’un leone avea faccia e contegno.
query.result:
**English:**
58 And as I come looking among them, 59 in a yellow purse I saw azure 60 that had the face and bearing of a lion.
**Malay:**
58 Dan ketika aku melihat di antara mereka, 59 di dalam sebuah dompet kuning aku melihat biru 60 yang memiliki wajah dan sikap seekor singa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Poi, procedendo di mio sguardo il curro, 62 vidine un’altra come sangue rossa, 63 mostrando un’oca bianca più che burro.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Then, proceeding with my gaze ahead, 62 I saw another one as red as blood, 63 showing a white goose, whiter than butter.
**Malay:**
61 Kemudian, melangkah maju dengan pandanganku ke depan, 62 kulihat yang lain semerah darah, 63 menunjukkan seekor angsa putih, lebih putih dari mentega.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 E un che d’una scrofa azzurra e grossa 65 segnato avea lo suo sacchetto bianco, 66 mi disse: «Che fai tu in questa fossa?
67 Or te ne va; e perché se’ vivo anco, 68 sappi che ’l mio vicin Vitalïano 69 sederà qui dal mio sinistro fianco.
query.result:
**English:**
64 And one who had his white pouch marked 65 with a big blue sow, 66 said to me: "What are you doing in this ditch?
67 Now go away; and since you are still alive, 68 know that my neighbor Vitaliano 69 will sit here on my left side.
**Malay:**
64 Dan seorang yang kantong putihnya ditandai 65 dengan babi hutan biru yang besar, 66 berkata kepadaku: "Apa yang kamu lakukan di parit ini?
67 Sekarang pergilah; dan karena kamu masih hidup, 68 ketahuilah bahwa tetanggaku Vitaliano 69 akan duduk di sini di sebelah kiriku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 Con questi Fiorentin son padoano: 71 spesse fïate mi ’ntronan li orecchi 72 gridando: “Vegna ’l cavalier sovrano,
73 che recherà la tasca con tre becchi!”».
query.result:
**English:**
70 With these Florentines I am a Paduan: 71 often they deafen my ears 72 shouting: “Let the sovereign knight come,
73 who will bring the pouch with three beaks!”
**Malay:**
70 Bersama orang-orang Florentine ini aku adalah seorang Paduan: 71 sering kali mereka memekakkan telingaku 72 berteriak: “Biarlah ksatria berdaulat itu datang,
73 yang akan membawa kantong dengan tiga paruh!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
74 Qui distorse la bocca e di fuor trasse 75 la lingua, come bue che ’l naso lecchi.
76 E io, temendo no ’l più star crucciasse 77 lui che di poco star m’avea ’mmonito, 78 torna’mi in dietro da l’anime lasse.
query.result:
**English:**
74 Here he twisted his mouth and stuck out 75 his tongue, like an ox that licks its nose.
76 And I, fearing that he might torment himself further, 77 he who had just warned me to stay away, 78 turned back from the weary souls.
**Malay:**
74 Di sini dia memutar mulutnya dan menjulurkan 75 lidahnya, seperti lembu yang menjilati hidungnya.
76 Dan aku, takut kalau-kalau dia akan lebih menyiksa dirinya sendiri, 77 dia yang baru saja memperingatkanku untuk menjauh, 78 berpaling dari jiwa-jiwa yang lelah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
79 Trova’ il duca mio ch’era salito 80 già su la groppa del fiero animale, 81 e disse a me: «Or sie forte e ardito.
query.result:
**English:**
79 My guide found who had climbed up 80 onto the back of the fierce beast, 81 and said to me: "Now be strong and bold.
**Malay:**
79 Pemimpinku menemukan yang telah memanjat 80 ke atas punggung binatang buas itu, 81 dan berkata kepadaku: "Sekarang jadilah kuat dan berani.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 Omai si scende per sì fatte scale; 83 monta dinanzi, ch’i’ voglio esser mezzo, 84 sì che la coda non possa far male».
query.result:
**English:**
82 Oh, one descends by such stairs; 83 go ahead, for I want to be in the middle, 84 so that the tail cannot do harm."
**Malay:**
82 Oh, seseorang turun melalui tangga seperti itu; 83 naiklah di depan, karena aku ingin berada di tengah, 84 sehingga ekornya tidak dapat berbuat jahat."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Qual è colui che sì presso ha ’l riprezzo 86 de la quartana, c’ha già l’unghie smorte, 87 e triema tutto pur guardando ’l rezzo,
88 tal divenn’ io a le parole porte; 89 ma vergogna mi fé le sue minacce, 90 che innanzi a buon segnor fa servo forte.
query.result:
**English:**
85 What is he who is so close to the shivering 86 of the quartan fever, that he already has pale nails, 87 and trembles all over, even looking at the shade,
88 such I became at the words spoken; 89 but shame made me strong against his threats, 90 which makes a servant strong before a good lord.
**Malay:**
85 Bagaimana dengan orang yang begitu dekat dengan menggigil 86 demam quartana, yang kukunya sudah pucat, 87 dan gemetar seluruhnya bahkan melihat keteduhan,
88 begitulah aku mendengar kata-kata yang diucapkan; 89 tetapi rasa malu membuatku kuat melawan ancamannya, 90 yang membuat seorang hamba kuat di hadapan tuan yang baik.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 I’ m’assettai in su quelle spallacce; 92 sì volli dir, ma la voce non venne 93 com’ io credetti: ‘Fa che tu m’abbracce’.
query.result:
**English:**
91 I settled myself on those broad shoulders; 92 I wanted to say to him, but my voice did not come 93 as I thought: ‘Embrace me’.
**Malay:**
91 Aku duduk di atas bahu yang lebar itu; 92 begitulah yang ingin kukatakan, tetapi suaraku tidak keluar 93 seperti yang kukira: ‘Peluklah aku’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 Come la navicella esce di loco 101 in dietro in dietro, sì quindi si tolse; 102 e poi ch’al tutto si sentì a gioco,
103 là ’v’ era ’l petto, la coda rivolse, 104 e quella tesa, come anguilla, mosse, 105 e con le branche l’aere a sé raccolse.
query.result:
**English:**
100 As a little ship leaves its place, 101 backward, backward, so did he remove himself; 102 and after he felt himself entirely at play,
103 there where his chest had been, he turned his tail, 104 and moved that forked part, like an eel, 105 and with his arms gathered the air to himself.
**Malay:**
100 Seperti perahu kecil meninggalkan tempatnya, 101 mundur, mundur, demikianlah ia menyingkir; 102 dan setelah ia merasa sepenuhnya bermain-main,
103 di sana tempat dadanya berada, ia memutar ekornya, 104 dan menggerakkan bagian yang bercabang itu, seperti belut, 105 dan dengan lengannya mengumpulkan udara untuk dirinya sendiri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 Maggior paura non credo che fosse 107 quando Fetonte abbandonò li freni, 108 per che ’l ciel, come pare ancor, si cosse;
109 né quando Icaro misero le reni 110 sentì spennar per la scaldata cera, 111 gridando il padre a lui «Mala via tieni!»,
112 che fu la mia, quando vidi ch’i’ era 113 ne l’aere d’ogne parte, e vidi spenta 114 ogne veduta fuor che de la fera.
query.result:
**English:**
106 I do not believe there was greater fear 107 when Phaethon abandoned the reins, 108 so that the sky, as it still appears, was scorched;
109 nor when wretched Icarus felt his wings 110 melt because of the heated wax, 111 his father crying out to him, “You are taking a bad course!”,
112 than mine was when I saw that I was 113 in the air on all sides, and I saw every 114 sight extinguished except for that of the beast.
**Malay:**
106 Aku tidak percaya ada ketakutan yang lebih besar 107 ketika Phaethon meninggalkan kendali, 108 sehingga langit, seperti yang masih terlihat, hangus;
109 atau ketika Icarus yang malang merasakan sayapnya 110 meleleh karena lilin yang panas, 111 ayahnya berteriak kepadanya, "Kamu mengambil jalan yang salah!",
112 daripada ketakutanku, ketika aku melihat bahwa aku berada 113 di udara di semua sisi, dan aku melihat setiap 114 pemandangan padam kecuali pemandangan binatang buas itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 Ella sen va notando lenta lenta; 116 rota e discende, ma non me n’accorgo 117 se non che al viso e di sotto mi venta.
query.result:
**English:**
115 She goes on, observing slowly, slowly; 116 she circles and descends, but I do not notice 117 except that the wind blows on my face and from below.
**Malay:**
115 Dia terus berjalan, mengamati perlahan, perlahan; 116 berputar dan turun, tetapi aku tidak menyadarinya 117 kecuali bahwa angin bertiup di wajahku dan dari bawah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Io sentia già da la man destra il gorgo 119 far sotto noi un orribile scroscio, 120 per che con li occhi ’n giù la testa sporgo.
query.result:
**English:**
118 I already felt from the right-hand side the whirlpool 119 making a horrible roar below us, 120 so that I thrust my head down with my eyes.
**Malay:**
118 Aku sudah merasakan dari sebelah kanan 119 pusaran air membuat gemuruh yang mengerikan di bawah kami, 120 sehingga dengan mata menunduk aku menjulurkan kepala.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 Allor fu’ io più timido a lo stoscio, 122 però ch’i’ vidi fuochi e senti’ pianti; 123 ond’ io tremando tutto mi raccoscio.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Then I was more timid at the rustling, 122 because I saw fires and heard cries; 123 whereat I, trembling, all huddled up.
**Malay:**
121 Lalu aku menjadi lebih takut pada gemerisik itu, 122 karena aku melihat api dan mendengar tangisan; 123 di mana aku, gemetar, meringkuk seluruhnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 E vidi poi, ché nol vedea davanti, 125 lo scendere e ’l girar per li gran mali 126 che s’appressavan da diversi canti.
query.result:
**English:**
124 And then I saw, because I could not see ahead, 125 the descent and the circling of the great evils 126 that were approaching from different directions.
**Malay:**
124 Dan kemudian kulihat, karena aku tidak dapat melihat ke depan, 125 turunnya dan berputar-putarnya kejahatan besar 126 yang mendekat dari berbagai arah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Come ’l falcon ch’è stato assai su l’ali, 128 che sanza veder logoro o uccello 129 fa dire al falconiere «Omè, tu cali!»,
130 discende lasso onde si move isnello, 131 per cento rote, e da lunge si pone 132 dal suo maestro, disdegnoso e fello;
133 così ne puose al fondo Gerïone 134 al piè al piè de la stagliata rocca, 135 e, discarcate le nostre persone,
136 si dileguò come da corda cocca.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Like the falcon that has been high up in the air, 128 that without seeing lure or bird 129 makes the falconer say, "Oh, you're dropping!",
130 descends tired from where it moved swiftly, 131 in a hundred circles, and alights at a distance 132 from its master, disdainful and fierce;
133 so Geryon set us down at the bottom 134 at the foot of the steep cliff, 135 and, our persons unloaded,
136 sped away like an arrow from a bowstring.
**Malay:**
127 Seperti elang yang telah lama terbang tinggi, 128 yang tanpa melihat umpan atau burung 129 membuat si pemburu berkata, "Aduh, kau jatuh!",
130 turun lelah dari tempat ia bergerak cepat, 131 dalam seratus putaran, dan hinggap di kejauhan 132 dari tuannya, jijik dan galak;
133 begitulah Gerion menurunkan kami ke dasar 134 di kaki tebing yang terjal, 135 dan, setelah menurunkan kami,
136 menghilang seperti anak panah dari tali busur.
